meta.title: Security — Execution-Level Guardrails | Data Science Technologies
meta.description: Data Science Technologies is building execution-level security controls for agentic AI systems that extend beyond prompt filtering while remaining grounded in production-ready enforcement.
meta.keywords: AI security, execution-level guardrails, runtime risk containment, agentic AI governance, AI-BOM, agent discovery

intro: Security in agentic AI systems is not just about blocking bad inputs — it is about governing behavior as systems act. Data Science Technologies is building execution-level security controls that extend beyond prompt filtering while remaining grounded in production-ready enforcement.

runtime_risk.title: Runtime Risk Containment
runtime_risk.description: The architecture is designed to support authorization of actions before execution, mediation of tool and API usage, prevention of unsafe behavior, and intervention when risk thresholds are exceeded. These capabilities build on the existing enforcement pipeline.
items: Mediation of tool and API usage
Prevention of unsafe or unintended behavior
Intervention when risk thresholds are exceeded

stateful_risk.title: Stateful & Trajectory-Based Risk
stateful_risk.description: The security model is designed to reason about agent behavior over time — not just individual requests. This enables detection of:
items: Emergent behavior that only becomes apparent across sequences of actions

tool_mediation.title: Active Tool Mediation
tool_mediation.description: The platform is actively developing the ability to mediate tool, API, and system command execution within agentic workflows. This capability is being validated with design partners to ensure safe and predictable behavior before broader availability.

inter_agent.title: Inter-Agent Governance
inter_agent.description: The security design is intended to extend into inter-agent governance as multi-agent systems emerge. This includes addressing:

discovery.title: Automated Agent Discovery
discovery.description: The platform is evolving toward automated discovery of active agents, their identities, and permission scopes. Early capabilities focus on inventory and visibility to help teams surface shadow AI and understand what autonomous systems are operating in their environment.

explainability.title: Explainability & Reason Codes
explainability.description: Enforcement decisions are designed to produce clear reason codes explaining why actions were blocked or modified. This supports:
items: Operator trust as execution-level controls mature

human_in_loop.title: Human-in-the-Loop Controls
human_in_loop.description: The security design supports pausing execution for human review, escalating high-risk actions, and introducing approval workflows where oversight is required. These controls are designed to complement automation without disrupting normal execution paths.

runtime_visibility.title: End-to-End Runtime Visibility
runtime_visibility.description: The architecture supports continuous monitoring of agent decisions and actions, traceability across prompts, tools, and outcomes, and the creation of verifiable decision trails as execution-level capabilities mature.

summary.title: Summary
items: A credible path toward execution-level governance
Future-ready controls for increasingly agentic systems
summary.closing: Security is built into the execution path — and evolves alongside agent autonomy.
